title: Disabled Veteran Homestead Property Tax Exemption
summary: Veterans with a 100% VA service-connected disability may qualify for an expanded homestead property tax exemption on their primary residence.
eligibilityNotes: Must be a resident of Ohio and rated 100% P&T by the VA. Surviving spouses may also be eligible. Apply through your County Auditor. Rates may vary by county. See official page.

title: Ohio Veterans Bonus Program
summary: A cash bonus for veterans who served during eligible service periods (e.g., Persian Gulf, Iraq, Afghanistan).

requirements.notes: Service must meet eligible period criteria (e.g., OIF/OEF). See official resources for eligibility.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans who meet the service period criteria and Ohio residency can apply for the bonus. Contact your CVSO for details.

title: Ohio Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses (Five-Year)
summary: Permanent and totally disabled Ohio veterans and former POWs may receive a free five-year hunting and fishing license, including permits and stamps.
eligibilityNotes: Veterans must provide documentation of disability status or POW service. Benefits include multiple licenses and permits at no cost.

title: Free Watercraft Registration for Disabled Veterans
summary: Ohio offers free registration of personal watercraft for qualifying residents who are 100% permanently and totally disabled, former POWs, or Medal of Honor recipients.
eligibilityNotes: Documentation of disability status, POW status, or Medal of Honor needed. See official guidelines for state registration exemptions.

title: Ohio Veteran Designation on Driver License or ID
summary: Veterans can receive a veteran designation on their Ohio driver’s license or ID card at no additional cost with proper documentation.

requirements.notes: Valid DD-214 or equivalent documentation required; honorable or general under honorable conditions discharge preferred.

eligibilityNotes: Visit a BMV deputy registrar with DD-214, current orders, or VA ID to request the veteran designation.

title: Ohio Heroes Home Loan & Housing Assistance
summary: Programs such as the Ohio Heroes Home Loan may offer lower mortgage interest and home purchase assistance benefits to veterans.

requirements.notes: Qualification depends on credit, income, and OHFA program requirements; not always tied to disability rating.

eligibilityNotes: Contact the Ohio Housing Finance Agency or Ohio Heroes Home Loan program for full eligibility criteria.

title: Ohio Veteran Employment Preference
summary: Veterans may receive preference points or credits on Ohio civil service exams and hiring.

requirements.notes: Veterans’ hiring preference varies by employer and civil service guidelines; check official state employment resources for details.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans should provide DD-214 or equivalent documentation for hiring preference or civil service exam credit.

title: Ohio State Veterans Homes
summary: State-operated veterans homes providing long-term and domiciliary care for eligible veterans in Sandusky and Georgetown.

requirements.notes: Admission depends on care needs, eligibility, and bed availability; contact the facilities directly.

eligibilityNotes: Applicants must meet Ohio and VA eligibility criteria; spouses may be eligible in limited circumstances. Contact the Ohio Veterans Homes for details.

title: Ohio Veterans Bonus Program
summary: Cash bonus for veterans who served during eligible service periods (Persian Gulf, Iraq/OIF, Afghanistan/OEF).

requirements.notes: Service must meet eligible period criteria. Ohio residency required.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans who meet service period criteria and Ohio residency can apply for cash bonus. Contact County Veterans Service Office for details and application.

title: Ohio Heroes Home Loan Program
summary: Lower mortgage interest rates and home purchase assistance through Ohio Housing Finance Agency.

requirements.notes: Qualification depends on credit, income, and OHFA program requirements. Not tied to disability rating.

eligibilityNotes: Provides below-market interest rates and home purchase assistance. Contact Ohio Housing Finance Agency for full eligibility criteria.

title: Free 5-Year Hunting/Fishing License (POW)
summary: Free five-year hunting and fishing license including multiple permits and stamps for former POWs.

requirements.notes: Available to former Prisoners of War in addition to 100% P&T disabled veterans.

eligibilityNotes: Former POWs receive free 5-year comprehensive hunting/fishing license with permits. Provide POW documentation.

title: Ohio Veteran Designation on Driver License
summary: Veterans can receive veteran designation on Ohio driver's license or ID card at no additional cost.

requirements.notes: Valid DD-214 or equivalent required. Honorable or general under honorable conditions discharge preferred.

eligibilityNotes: Visit BMV deputy registrar with DD-214, current orders, or VA ID to request veteran designation.

title: Sales Tax Refund for Disabled/Seniors
summary: Yearly sales tax refund for seniors 65+ or disabled individuals with low income.

requirements.notes: Must meet low-income criteria. Checks start in September.

eligibilityNotes: Seniors or individuals disabled per Social Security Act with low income can claim yearly refund.

title: Ohio National Guard Scholarship Program (ONGSP)
summary: 100% tuition coverage at Ohio public colleges and universities, or 100% of average public tuition rate at private institutions for Ohio National Guard members through unit-based scholarship system.

requirements.notes: Must be enlisted OH Army or Air National Guard member in good standing. 6-year enlistment required for full benefits (96 units). 3-5 year enlistment eligible for reduced benefits (48 units).

eligibilityNotes: Covers 100% tuition at OH state-assisted colleges/universities (base tuition/general fees only - not lab/course/assessment fees). At approved private institutions, pays 100% of average state university tuition rate. Unit-based system: 96 units for 6-year enlistment, 48 units for 3-5 year enlistment. Maximum 12 units charged per term regardless of credit hours. Available for associate, bachelor, diploma-granting nursing programs, and approved trade certifications/NTEP programs. Minimum 3 credit hours per term. Army Guard must exhaust Federal TA first. Recoupment required if fail to complete enlistment obligation. Apply through unit reviewer via Ohio National Guard Scholarship Website (oh.oharng.mbx.ong-scholarship@mail.mil).
